nl.inl.blacklab.perdocument

Class DocResults

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.perdocument.DocResults
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<DocResult>, Prioritizable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DocResultsWindow

    public class DocResults
extends Object
implements Iterable<DocResult>, Prioritizable
    A list of DocResult objects (document-level query results).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected List<DocResult> results
      (Part of) our document results

                                   Hits hits)
        Don't use this; use Hits.perDocResults().
        Parameters:

        hits - hits to get per-doc result for
        Returns:
        the per-document results.

      • _fromQuery

                                    org.apache.lucene.search.Query query)
        Don't use this, use Searcher.queryDocuments().
        Parameters:
        searcher - searcher object
        query - query to execute
        Returns:
        per-document results

      • sizeAtLeast

        public boolean sizeAtLeast(int lowerBound)
        Determines if there are at least a certain number of results This may be used if we don't want to process all results (which may be a lot) but we do need to know something about the size of the result set (such as for paging).
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - the number we're testing against
        Returns:
        true if the size of this set is at least lowerBound, false otherwise.

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the number of documents in this results set. Note that this returns the number of document results available; if there were so many hits that not all were retrieved (call maxHitsRetrieved()), you can find the grand total of documents by calling totalSize().
        Returns:
        the number of documents.

      • totalSize

        public int totalSize()
        Get the total number of documents. This even counts documents that weren't retrieved because the set of hits was too large.
        Returns:
        the total number of documents.

      • sort

        public void sort(DocProperty prop,
                 boolean sortReverse)
        Sort documents based on a document property.
        Parameters:
        prop - the property to sort on
        sortReverse - true iff we want to sort in reverse.

      • subList

        public List<DocResult> subList(int fromIndex,
                               int toIndex)
        Retrieve a sublist of hits.
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - first hit to include in the resulting list
        toIndex - first hit not to include in the resulting list
        Returns:
        the sublist

      • maxHitsRetrieved

        public boolean maxHitsRetrieved()
        Did we stop retrieving hits because we reached the maximum?
        Returns:
        true if we reached the maximum and stopped retrieving hits

      • maxHitsCounted

        public boolean maxHitsCounted()
        Did we stop counting hits because we reached the maximum?
        Returns:
        true if we reached the maximum and stopped counting hits

      • getOriginalHits

        public Hits getOriginalHits()

      • countBy

        public DocCounts countBy(DocProperty countBy)
        Count the number of results that have the same value for the specified property. Basically a grouping operation without storing the results. Used for e.g. faceted search.
        Parameters:
        countBy - property to count
        Returns:
        the counts

      • intSum

        public int intSum(DocProperty numProp)
        Sum a property for all the documents. Can be used to calculate the total number of tokens in a subcorpus, for example. Note that this does retrieve all results, so it may be slow for large sets. In particular, you should try to call this method only for DocResults created with Searcher.queryDocuments() (and not ones created with Hits.perDocResults()) to avoid the overhead of fetching hits.
        Parameters:
        numProp - a numeric property to sum
        Returns:
        the sum

      • setPriorityLevel

        public void setPriorityLevel(ThreadPriority.Level level)
        Description copied from interface: Prioritizable
        Set the thread priority level for this Hits object. Allows us to set a query to low-priority, or to (almost) pause it.
        Specified by:
        setPriorityLevel in interface Prioritizable
        Parameters:
        level - the desired priority level

      • getPriorityLevel

        public ThreadPriority.Level getPriorityLevel()
        Description copied from interface: Prioritizable
        Get the thread priority level for this Hits object. Can be normal, low-priority, or (almost) paused.
        Specified by:
        getPriorityLevel in interface Prioritizable
        Returns:
        the current priority level
